monuments.name: Humayun's Tomb
monuments.description: Exemplifying the formative stage of Mughal architecture, Humayun's Tomb represents the earliest extant specimen of the Mughal garden tomb.

monuments.name: Jama Masjid
monuments.description: One of the largest mosques in India, Jama Masjid stands as an iconic landmark in Old Delhi.

monuments.name: Red Fort
monuments.description: Red Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site, served as the main residence of the Mughal emperors for nearly 200 years.

monuments.name: Qutub Minar
monuments.description: Qutub Minar, the tallest brick minaret in the world, is an iconic example of Indo-Islamic architecture.

monuments.name: India Gate
monuments.description: India Gate is a war memorial located astride the Rajpath, and it commemorates the soldiers who died during World War I.

monuments.name: Lotus Temple
monuments.description: Known for its flowerlike shape, Lotus Temple is a prominent Bahá'í House of Worship in Delhi.

amusement parks.name: Adventure Island
amusement parks.description: Adventure Island is a popular amusement park in Delhi offering rides and attractions for all ages.

amusement parks.name: Worlds of Wonder
amusement parks.description: Worlds of Wonder is one of the largest amusement and water parks in Delhi NCR.

amusement parks.name: Fun N Food Village
amusement parks.description: Fun N Food Village offers a combination of amusement rides and a water park, making it a popular destination for families.

amusement parks.name: Delhi Eye
amusement parks.description: Delhi Eye is a giant Ferris wheel located in Kalindi Kunj, offering panoramic views of Delhi.

amusement parks.name: Appu Ghar
amusement parks.description: Appu Ghar is an iconic amusement park in Delhi, popular among children and families.

amusement parks.name: Snow World
amusement parks.description: Snow World offers a snowy wonderland with various activities such as skiing, sledding, and snowball fights.

museums.name: National Museum
museums.description: The National Museum is one of the largest museums in India, featuring collections of artifacts dating back to the Indus Valley Civilization.

museums.name: National Rail Museum
museums.description: The National Rail Museum showcases the rich heritage of Indian Railways with a display of locomotives and carriages.

museums.name: Nehru Planetarium
museums.description: Nehru Planetarium is a center for astronomical education and is popular among students and space enthusiasts.

museums.name: Gandhi Smriti
museums.description: Gandhi Smriti is a museum dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi, showcasing his life and teachings.

museums.name: Indira Gandhi Memorial Museum
museums.description: This museum is housed in the former residence of Indira Gandhi and features exhibits on her life and political career.

museums.name: Crafts Museum
museums.description: The Crafts Museum in Delhi showcases India's rich tradition of handicrafts, textiles, and folk art.

monuments.name: Gateway of India
monuments.description: The Gateway of India is a 20th-century monument in Mumbai, and it is an iconic landmark in the city's history.

monuments.name: Ajanta Caves
monuments.description: The Ajanta Caves are a UNESCO World Heritage Site and consist of ancient rock-cut Buddhist caves dating back to the 2nd century BCE.

monuments.name: Ellora Caves
monuments.description: Ellora Caves are a UNESCO World Heritage Site and feature rock-cut architecture representing Buddhist, Hindu, and Jain temples.

monuments.name: Shaniwar Wada
monuments.description: Shaniwar Wada is a historic fortification in Pune that served as the seat of the Peshwas of the Maratha Empire.

monuments.name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus
monuments.description: CST is a historic railway station in Mumbai and a UNESCO World Heritage Site, known for its Victorian Gothic architecture.

monuments.name: Raigad Fort
monuments.description: Raigad Fort is a hill fort that served as the capital of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's kingdom and is of great historical significance.

amusement parks.name: Imagicaa
amusement parks.description: Imagicaa is a popular amusement and theme park located near Mumbai and Pune, offering a wide range of rides and attractions.

amusement parks.name: EsselWorld
amusement parks.description: EsselWorld is one of India's largest amusement parks, offering roller coasters, water rides, and entertainment for all ages.

amusement parks.name: Water Kingdom
amusement parks.description: Water Kingdom, adjacent to EsselWorld, is one of Asia's largest water parks with thrilling water slides and wave pools.

amusement parks.name: Adlabs Aquamagica
amusement parks.description: Aquamagica is a water park offering a variety of water slides and attractions, perfect for a family day out.

amusement parks.name: Tikuji-ni-Wadi
amusement parks.description: Tikuji-ni-Wadi is an amusement park in Thane, offering a combination of rides, a water park, and a resort.

amusement parks.name: Della Adventure Park
amusement parks.description: Della Adventure Park is an extreme adventure park located in Lonavala, offering activities like bungee jumping, ATV rides, and zorbing.

museums.name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Vastu Sangrahalaya
museums.description: CSMVS is a premier art and history museum in Mumbai, showcasing a wide range of artifacts, paintings, and sculptures.

museums.name: Prince of Wales Museum
museums.description: Also known as the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Museum, this museum is renowned for its collection of ancient and medieval artifacts.

museums.name: Dr. Bhau Daji Lad Museum
museums.description: Dr. Bhau Daji Lad Museum in Mumbai is known for its collection of decorative arts and cultural artifacts.

museums.name: National Gallery of Modern Art
museums.description: NGMA in Mumbai showcases contemporary and modern art from Indian and international artists.

museums.name: Raja Dinkar Kelkar Museum
museums.description: This museum in Pune is dedicated to the collection of Raja Dinkar Kelkar, featuring everyday artifacts, sculptures, and decorative arts.

museums.name: Tribal Museum
museums.description: The Tribal Museum in Pune displays the cultural heritage and artifacts of Maharashtra's tribal communities.

monuments.name: Hawa Mahal
monuments.description: Hawa Mahal, also known as the 'Palace of Winds,' is a five-story palace in Jaipur with 953 small windows, or 'jharokhas,' built to allow royal ladies to observe street festivities.

monuments.name: Amber Fort
monuments.description: Amber Fort is a majestic fort located in Amer, near Jaipur, known for its artistic elements and architecture.

monuments.name: Jaisalmer Fort
monuments.description: Jaisalmer Fort, also known as Sonar Quila, is a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of the largest fully preserved fortified cities in the world.

monuments.name: City Palace
monuments.description: City Palace in Jaipur is a complex of courtyards, gardens, and buildings that served as the residence of the Maharaja of Jaipur.

monuments.name: Mehrangarh Fort
monuments.description: Mehrangarh Fort, located in Jodhpur, is one of the largest forts in India, known for its massive walls and intricate carvings.

monuments.name: Chittorgarh Fort
monuments.description: Chittorgarh Fort is a UNESCO World Heritage site and is one of the largest forts in India, known for its historical significance and architectural grandeur.

amusement parks.name: Appu Ghar Jaipur
amusement parks.description: Appu Ghar Jaipur is a popular amusement park offering rides, water slides, and family-friendly attractions.

amusement parks.name: Pink Pearl Water Park
amusement parks.description: Pink Pearl Water Park is a well-known water and amusement park in Jaipur offering a variety of slides and pools.

amusement parks.name: Birla City Water Park
amusement parks.description: Birla City Water Park in Ajmer is a popular destination for families, offering water slides, wave pools, and other fun attractions.

amusement parks.name: Marvel Water Park
amusement parks.description: Marvel Water Park in Udaipur is one of the first water parks in Rajasthan and features a range of water-based rides and activities.

amusement parks.name: Dream World Amusement Park
amusement parks.description: Located in Kota, Dream World Amusement Park offers thrilling rides and entertainment options for families.

amusement parks.name: Nakhrali Dhani
amusement parks.description: Nakhrali Dhani in Jaipur offers a unique amusement experience, blending rides and entertainment with traditional Rajasthani culture.

museums.name: Albert Hall Museum
museums.description: Albert Hall Museum in Jaipur is the oldest museum in Rajasthan, showcasing a rich collection of artifacts, paintings, and sculptures.

museums.name: City Palace Museum
museums.description: The museum inside Jaipur's City Palace houses a collection of royal artifacts, including costumes, textiles, and weapons.

museums.name: Bagore ki Haveli Museum
museums.description: Bagore ki Haveli in Udaipur is a 18th-century haveli turned museum that displays costumes and modern art.

museums.name: Jantar Mantar
museums.description: Jantar Mantar in Jaipur is a collection of 19 architectural astronomical instruments built by Sawai Jai Singh II, a UNESCO World Heritage site.

museums.name: Anokhi Museum of Hand Printing
museums.description: This museum in Jaipur is dedicated to the traditional art of hand block printing, showcasing exhibits and live demonstrations.

museums.name: Maharana Pratap Museum
museums.description: This museum in Haldighati is dedicated to the life and legacy of Maharana Pratap, a prominent ruler of Mewar.

monuments.name: Taj Mahal
monuments.description: The Taj Mahal in Agra is one of the Seven Wonders of the World and a UNESCO World Heritage site, known for its stunning Mughal architecture.

monuments.name: Agra Fort
monuments.description: Agra Fort is a massive red sandstone fort built by the Mughal Emperor Akbar and is another UNESCO World Heritage site in Agra.

monuments.name: Fatehpur Sikri
monuments.description: Fatehpur Sikri is a historical city built by Emperor Akbar, known for its well-preserved Mughal architecture.

monuments.name: Bara Imambara
monuments.description: Bara Imambara in Lucknow is a grand complex built by Nawab Asaf-ud-Daula and is famous for its central hall, one of the largest in the world.

monuments.name: Sarnath
monuments.description: Sarnath is a significant Buddhist pilgrimage site where Gautama Buddha delivered his first sermon.

monuments.name: Rumi Darwaza
monuments.description: Rumi Darwaza in Lucknow is an imposing gateway and a fine example of Awadhi architecture.

amusement parks.name: Dream World Water Park
amusement parks.description: Dream World Water Park in Lucknow offers a variety of water rides, slides, and pools, making it a popular destination for families.

amusement parks.name: Anandi Water Park
amusement parks.description: Anandi Water Park is one of the largest water parks in Northern India, located in Lucknow, featuring thrilling water rides and activities.

amusement parks.name: Fun City
amusement parks.description: Fun City in Bareilly is an amusement park offering a range of rides and entertainment for children and families.

amusement parks.name: Blue World Theme Park
amusement parks.description: Blue World in Kanpur is a popular amusement park featuring both thrill rides and water slides.

amusement parks.name: Disney Water Wonder Park
amusement parks.description: Located in Agra, Disney Water Wonder Park offers exciting water slides, pools, and entertainment for all ages.

amusement parks.name: Ganga Barrage Amusement Park
amusement parks.description: Ganga Barrage Amusement Park in Kanpur offers scenic views and a variety of rides and activities.

museums.name: Salar Jung Museum
museums.description: Salar Jung Museum in Hyderabad (though often associated with UP due to the historical connection) features one of the largest collections of art and antiques.

museums.name: State Museum Lucknow
museums.description: The State Museum in Lucknow showcases artifacts from the region’s rich cultural and historical heritage.

museums.name: Ram Katha Sangrahalay
museums.description: Ram Katha Sangrahalay in Ayodhya is dedicated to the epic Ramayana, featuring exhibits that depict the life and story of Lord Rama.

museums.name: Allahabad Museum
museums.description: Allahabad Museum in Prayagraj has a vast collection of historical artifacts, including sculptures, coins, and paintings.

museums.name: Jahangirabad Palace Museum
museums.description: Located in Barabanki, this museum showcases royal artifacts from the Jahangirabad estate.

museums.name: Kanpur Sangrahalaya
museums.description: Kanpur Sangrahalaya is the city's principal museum with exhibits on the city's history and culture.

monuments.name: Golden Temple
monuments.description: The Golden Temple in Amritsar is the holiest Gurdwara of Sikhism, known for its stunning architecture and spiritual significance.

monuments.name: Jallianwala Bagh
monuments.description: Jallianwala Bagh is a public garden in Amritsar, commemorating the tragic massacre of hundreds of unarmed Indians by British forces in 1919.

monuments.name: Sheesh Mahal
monuments.description: Sheesh Mahal in Patiala is a palace known for its mirror-work and Indo-Saracenic architecture.

monuments.name: Qila Mubarak
monuments.description: Qila Mubarak is a historical fort located in Bathinda and is considered one of the oldest surviving forts in India.

monuments.name: Anandpur Sahib
monuments.description: Anandpur Sahib is one of the holiest places in Sikhism, known for its historical significance and the celebration of Hola Mohalla.

monuments.name: Durgiana Temple
monuments.description: Durgiana Temple in Amritsar is a Hindu temple that resembles the architecture of the Golden Temple, dedicated to Goddess Durga.

amusement parks.name: Thunder Zone
amusement parks.description: Thunder Zone in Mohali is a popular amusement and water park with a variety of rides and slides.

amusement parks.name: Hardy's World
amusement parks.description: Hardy's World in Ludhiana is one of the largest amusement parks in Punjab, featuring rides and water attractions.

amusement parks.name: Suncity Amusement Park
amusement parks.description: Suncity Amusement Park in Jalandhar offers thrilling rides and entertainment for children and families.

amusement parks.name: Wonderland Amusement Park
amusement parks.description: Wonderland in Jalandhar is an amusement park with a range of exciting rides, water slides, and fun activities.

amusement parks.name: Fun City Amusement Park
amusement parks.description: Fun City in Chandigarh is an amusement park with a combination of thrilling rides and water park attractions.

amusement parks.name: Aqua Village
amusement parks.description: Located in Pinjore, Aqua Village offers a variety of water-based attractions for families.

museums.name: Partition Museum
museums.description: The Partition Museum in Amritsar is dedicated to the Partition of India in 1947, showcasing personal stories, artifacts, and documents.

museums.name: Maharaja Ranjit Singh Museum
museums.description: Located in Amritsar, this museum is dedicated to the life and legacy of Maharaja Ranjit Singh, the founder of the Sikh Empire.

museums.name: Punjab State War Heroes' Memorial & Museum
museums.alt: Punjab State War Heroes' Memorial & Museum
museums.description: This museum in Amritsar honors the soldiers of Punjab who sacrificed their lives for the nation.

museums.name: Virasat-e-Khalsa
museums.description: Located in Anandpur Sahib, this museum celebrates the history and culture of Sikhism.

museums.name: Shaheed Bhagat Singh Museum
museums.description: Situated in Khatkar Kalan, this museum is dedicated to the life and legacy of freedom fighter Bhagat Singh.

museums.name: Punjab Agricultural University Museum
museums.description: Located in Ludhiana, this museum showcases Punjab's agricultural history and heritage.

monuments.name: Kamakhya Temple
monuments.description: Kamakhya Temple in Guwahati is one of the most revered Shakti Peethas in India, dedicated to the goddess Kamakhya.

monuments.name: Rang Ghar
monuments.description: Rang Ghar in Sivasagar is an ancient amphitheater built by the Ahom kings and is one of the oldest surviving pavilions in Asia.

monuments.name: Sivasagar Sivadol
monuments.description: Sivadol is a group of ancient Hindu temples located on the banks of the Sivasagar Tank, dedicated to Lord Shiva.

monuments.name: Agnigarh Hill
monuments.description: Agnigarh Hill in Tezpur is a historical site associated with Hindu mythology, offering scenic views and lush greenery.

monuments.name: Talatal Ghar
monuments.description: Talatal Ghar in Sivasagar is a historic palace and military base built by the Ahom kings, featuring underground tunnels and architectural marvels.

monuments.name: Kareng Ghar
monuments.description: Kareng Ghar in Garhgaon is a palace built by the Ahom dynasty and is an important historical landmark.

amusement parks.name: Accoland
amusement parks.description: Accoland in Guwahati is the largest amusement and water park in Northeast India, featuring water slides, rides, and entertainment.

amusement parks.name: Greenwood Resort
amusement parks.description: Greenwood Resort near Guwahati offers a peaceful getaway with family-friendly activities, a water park, and scenic surroundings.

amusement parks.name: Dreamland Amusement Park
amusement parks.description: Dreamland Amusement Park in Guwahati offers a mix of exciting rides, water slides, and family entertainment.

amusement parks.name: Blue Paradise Water Park
amusement parks.description: Blue Paradise Water Park is a fun-filled water park located in Nalbari, offering a variety of slides and pools.

amusement parks.name: Wonderland Amusement Park
amusement parks.description: Wonderland Amusement Park in Guwahati offers a range of water-based activities and rides.

amusement parks.name: Bhuvaneshwari Park
amusement parks.description: Bhuvaneshwari Park in Guwahati offers scenic views and family-friendly activities, including a small amusement park.

museums.name: Assam State Museum
museums.description: The Assam State Museum in Guwahati is one of the oldest museums in Northeast India, showcasing artifacts and exhibits related to Assam's history, culture, and heritage.

museums.name: Srimanta Sankardev Kalakshetra
museums.description: Srimanta Sankardev Kalakshetra in Guwahati is a cultural institution that celebrates Assamese art, culture, and heritage.

museums.name: Tezpur Museum
museums.description: Tezpur Museum is a small museum that showcases artifacts and history related to the Tezpur region.

museums.name: Bishnu Rabha Smriti Museum
museums.description: This museum is dedicated to Bishnu Prasad Rabha, an Assamese cultural icon, and features his works and contributions.

museums.name: Dibrugarh University Museum
museums.description: Located on the campus of Dibrugarh University, this museum exhibits cultural and historical artifacts from the region.

museums.name: Assam Rajyik State Museum
museums.description: Situated in Guwahati, the Assam Rajyik State Museum is known for its diverse collection of sculptures, tribal artifacts, and ethnographic exhibits.
